alert.note: Alert for Liberty; Polk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 8:31PM CST until January 09 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Liberty and Polk. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen so far today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain falling in a short time period will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moss Hill, Rye and Romayor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
